author: bridge-bot
content: <francksyd> @ralexstokes is there already some bytecode (or Yul code) for this precompile?

author: bridge-bot
content: <mratsim> In 2019~2020 there was an EVM384 project for this but it for sure never went as far as MSM. People will have to use external libraries (re @francksyd: @ralexstokes is there already some bytecode (or Yul code) for this precompile?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/evm384-feedback-and-discussion/4533/8

https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/239

https://notes.ethereum.org/@axic/evm384-preview

https://notes.ethereum.org/@axic/evm384

https://notes.ethereum.org/@poemm/evm384-update5 (re @francksyd: @ralexstokes is there already some bytecode (or Yul code) for this precompile?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<nero_eth> Let me join you @ralexstokes and post this EIP here:
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7623-increase-calldata-cost/18647

The EIP proposes to raise calldata cost for Electra. As this impacts rollups, I'm super curious to hear opinions on the design suggested.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> Regarding 3

has any bridge dev team encountered difficulty in converting their architecture over to blobs? what is a reasonable timeline to expect most/all of them to blobify?

Blobs are annoying for zkVMs, though I think the issues will be solved within 2 months:

- cross-lang compilations issue: https://github.com/ethereum/c-kzg-4844/issues/398#issuecomment-1960929643
- loading trusted setup issues (syscalls and lots of unneeded ops) vs hardcoding it in zkVMs
- perf or implementing proof-of-equivalence (re @nero_eth: Let me join you @ralexstokes and post this EIP here:
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7623-increase-calldata-cost/18647

The EIP proposes to raise calldata cost for Electra. As this impacts rollups, I'm super curious to hear opinions on the design suggested.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <ralexstokes> the idea would be to implement these routines natively, the gas costs for the BLS arithmetic is _massive_ (re @francksyd: @ralexstokes is there already some bytecode (or Yul code) for this precompile?)

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> EVMMAX has modular math extensions that can bring gas down 10x, but given verkle's place in the axhedule I wouldn't expect it to ship until late 25 or early 26

author: bridge-bot
content: <ralexstokes> yeah EVMMAX et al are interesting directions but i don't see the R&D getting ready anytime soon and the benefits of EIP-2537 are clear enough to motivate shipping ASAP, even if that means more precompiles

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> IMHO 2537 should have shipped years ago.

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> But EVMMAX should put a throttle on precompile requests since gas will merely be bad and not awful.

author: bridge-bot
content: <mratsim> even if we had evmmax, MSM is too much of a bottleneck not too have a precompile. (re @ralexstokes: yeah EVMMAX et al are interesting directions but i don't see the R&D getting ready anytime soon and the benefits of EIP-2537 are clear enough to motivate shipping ASAP, even if that means more precompiles)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> we don't really have that many arithmetic precompiles.

MODEXP, ECADD, ECMUL, ECPAIRING and 2537. (re @shemnon: But EVMMAX should put a throttle on precompile requests since gas will merely be bad and not awful.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> When should something be a precompile vs an opcode?

author: bridge-bot
content: <vb271828> opcodes are generally very basic operations

author: bridge-bot
content: <vb271828> keccak is an unprincipled exception; it's in there because it's so fundamental to ethereum (for now üòÅ)

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> Op code space is much more limited too. Default is precompile for me.  Only if gas is less than 100 should it even be considered IMHO.
